p: Structural changes in NCN0.25 in the dependences ε′/ ε 0( T) and tg δ( T) appeared by the increase in the dispersion with increasing temperature and by the maximum tg δ ( T) at 450 K, which corresponds to the phase transition R2 → R3. The features of the NCN0.25 structure are also reflected in the ε′/ε 0( T) dependence in the heating – cooling mode. In the heating mode, the weak maximum ε′/ε 0( T) in the region of 370 K, most noticeable at low frequencies, corresponds to the appearance of the intermediate phase R2 (see Fig. 6). Its absence in the cooling mode is due to the fact that when NCN0.25 is cooled from the high-temperature phase R3, the latter does not immediately go into the low-temperature phase R1, but remains at room temperature for several days (see Fig. 5 a).
